required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Animal and Plant Proteins and Glucose Metabolism
clinical_study.official_title: Animal and Plant Proteins and Glucose Metabolism

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this proposal is to determine the effect of a high protein diet in which the increase in protein intake is derived from different sources (animal vs plant and protein-rich whole foods vs protein isolates) on: i) liver and muscle insulin sensitivity; ii) the metabolic response to a meal, and iii) 24-h plasma concentration profiles of glucose, glucoregulatory hormones, and protein-derived metabolites purported to cause metabolic dysfunction.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 12 weeks after the intervention

primary_outcome.measure: Insulin sensitivity assessed as insulin-mediated glucose disposal during a hyperinsulinemic-euglycemic clamp procedure
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 12 weeks after the intervention

intervention.description: Increased dietary protein content from animal protein isolates
Increased dietary protein content from animal protein whole food
Increased dietary protein content from plant protein isolates
Increased dietary protein content from animal protein whole food
